words.def: Adventure: A single or linked set of games.
words.name: Adventure

words.def: AoE: Area of Effect
words.name: AoE

words.def: Campaign: A series of adventures.
words.name: Campaign

words.def: Character: A fictional character in a role-playing game; a player character or non-player character.
words.name: Character

words.def: Character sheet: A record of a player character in a role-playing game, including whatever details, notes, game statistics, and background information a player would need during a play session.
words.name: Character sheet

words.def: Character creation: The method used to create a character, especially a player character.
words.name: Character creation

words.def: Critical: A type of result associated with a strong outcome, especially a critical hit or critical failure (fumble). Often related to unlikely die results, as a natural 1 or 20, doubles, and so forth.
words.name: Critical

words.def: Fumble: An unforced error when attempting a difficult task. Also known as a Botch.
words.name: Fumble

words.def: Game master: The person who runs a role-playing game and arbitrates how actions are resolved and narrated. Abbreviated GM. In many games, specialized terms are used, as such Dungeon Master for someone running Dungeons & Dragons.
words.name: Game master

words.def: Gamemaster's screen: a foldout cardboard-made accessory, used by the game master to hide from the players' eyes any information related to the adventure they are playing. Abbreviated GM screen (or DM screen when talking about Dungeons & Dragons gamemaster's screens).
words.name: Gamemaster's screen

words.def: Initiative : The determination of who goes first and in what order declared actions are carried out.
words.name: Initiative

words.def: Metagaming: Using out-of-character knowledge to solve in-character problems, or to explain in-character behaviour.
words.name: Metagaming

words.def: Modifier: A number added to or subtracted from a die roll.
words.name: Modifier

words.def: Natural (roll): The number actually on a die, such as a natural 1 or a natural 20, indicating the die's face shows a 1 or a 20.
words.name: Natural (roll)

words.def: Saving throw: A game mechanic in which dice are used to avoid some kind of negative effect on a character.
words.name: Saving throw

words.def: Session: A single meeting of a role-playing group.
words.name: Session

words.def: Setting: The fictional world in which the game takes place.
words.name: Setting

words.def: Story guide: Also, ‘’storyteller.’’ The game master of a game with a strong focus on narrative tropes.[1]
words.name: Story guide

words.def: System: The set of game mechanics which make up a game.
words.name: System

words.def: Troupe system: A system in which the duties of the game master are distributed amongst the players.
words.name: Troupe system

words.def: Advantage: A positive or useful statistic or trait.
words.name: Advantage

words.def: Attributes: Natural, in-born characteristics shared by all characters, such as physical strength or wisdom.
words.name: Attributes

words.def: Age: Describes how many years, months, or days old your character is.
words.name: Age

words.def: Derived statistic: A secondary characteristic based on a character's attributes (or primary characteristics), including temporary effects like hit points and magic points.
words.name: Derived statistic

words.def: Powers: Extraordinary abilities which make a character special, such as flight or telepathy.
words.name: Powers

words.def: Race: A character's species, ethnicity, type, or other description of their physical and cultural heredity. Role-playing games often include fantasy races, mutants, robots and other non-human types.
words.name: Race

words.def: Skills: Learned capabilities, such as spoken languages, horse riding or computer hacking.
words.name: Skills

words.def: Statistic: Any attribute, advantage, disadvantage, power, skill, or other trait. In the plural, statistics refers to the information on a character sheet.
words.name: Statistic

words.def: Crunch: The mechanics of a game.[2]
words.name: Crunch

words.def: Free-form role-playing game: A rules-light style of game that mostly uses social dynamics for its game system.[1]
words.name: Free-form role-playing game

words.def: Fluff: The setting and ambiance.[2]
words.name: Fluff

words.def: Gamist: A term from GNS theory describing games in which enjoyment is derived from facing and overcoming challenges.
words.name: Gamist

words.def: Generic: A System that can support a wide variety of settings.
words.name: Generic

words.def: Genre: A game that adheres to certain fictional tropes, such as fantasy or science fiction.
words.name: Genre

words.def: Live-action: A type of role-playing game physically enacted in a troupe acting style.
words.name: Live-action

words.def: Narrativist: A term from GNS theory describing games in which enjoyment is derived from creating a good story.
words.name: Narrativist

words.def: Online: A type of computer game that uses role-playing game style game mechanics and tropes.
words.name: Online

words.def: Rules-heavy: A game system with heavily codified mechanics, usually encompassing a wide variety of possible actions in a game. The opposite of rules-lite.
words.name: Rules-heavy

words.def: Rules-lite: A game system that uses very general mechanics, usually focused on a subset of possible actions in a game. The opposite of rules-heavy.
words.name: Rules-lite

words.def: Simulationist: A term from GNS theory for games in which enjoyment is derived from deep immersion in a new (simulated) world.
words.name: Simulationist

words.def: Blue booking: One or a few of the players describing activities of their characters in written form, outside of the role-playing session, creating a sort of ongoing character history and resolving actions that don’t involve the rest of the group.[1]
words.name: Blue booking

words.def: Monty haul: A pun on Monty Hall (the former host of Let's Make A Deal), when equipment, abilities, and other rewards get out of hand.
words.name: Monty haul

words.def: Munchkin: An immature player, especially one who is selfishly focused on dominating play, often by seeking to circumvent the normal limitations placed on characters.
words.name: Munchkin

words.def: Powergamer : A player focused on system mastery; a min-maxer.[1]
words.name: Powergamer

words.def: Roll-playing: A derisive term for rules-heavy games, occasionally to the point of requiring players to focus on game mechanics at the expense of role-playing.[3]
words.name: Roll-playing

words.def: Rules lawyer: A player who strictly adheres to the rules as written, and enforces them among all other players.
words.name: Rules lawyer

words.def: Twink: A player who engages in system mastery with an explicit focus of exploiting powerful abilities. Similar to powergamer.
words.name: Twink
